SUMMARY
The most obvious method of publicizing the Placement Service is through the
NAEB Newsletter Supplement. This publication v/ill cover all members of the*
NAEB, but it is felt that more than this area should be covered. Therefore,
it is recommended that the Placement Service seek by appropriate means to
gain attention in other trade magazines and newspapers and, if possible,
in magazines and other publications not specifically devoted to television
and radio.
In regard to the Newsletter Supplement, it is felt that perhaps a list of
job openings should be included with the applicants' advertisements. Naturally,
there would be no mentioning of the employers' names, and all actions regarcU
ing these advertisements would center around the Placement Service. If
desired, the Placement Service will obtain the v/ritten permission of the
employer to circulate his need. It is felt that this extra service would
increase the desire of employers to make use of the Placement Service, It
is strongly felt that any and all publicity received by the Placement Service
will increase its prestige and contribute to its expansion. (See Appendix G.)
GENERAL SUMMARY
It is felt that the above report is generally self-explanatory. With the
growth of the Placement Service, it has been necessary to give greater
attention to the keeping of accurate files, hence so much devotion of space
to the filing system, procedures, etc.
It may be safely stated that the Placement Service has passed its settling
down stage. During the first year of its operation many errors were made.
In many instances the Placement Service has learned of pitfalls the hard
way? by falling into them. Yet much has been accomplished, and it is felt
that the above report is encouraging in that it narrates a tale of progress.
While there is much to be done, the Placement Service enters its new year
confident that it can successfully conclude any task assigned to it, and with
the promise that it will continually seek to improve itself and its service
to educational broadcasting.
